lines: You have just taken off your socks and shoes after a long, tiring day. You would like nothing more than to begin a nice, lazy, relaxing evening. The clothes hamper seems a mile away.
#WALK OVER TO THE HAMPER AND PLACE THEM INSIDE
#WALK OVER TO THE HAMPER AND PLACE THEM INSIDE

I'll bet this isn't the first time you've done this! Look under there -- it's a regular sock convention. There are some pairs, but mostly it's a singles gathering. That's because the bed charges a one sock rental fee for each sock it
shelters (yes, you've finally found out where all of those socks go). How do you feel about being a little bit of a slob?
That's the spirit. It's no big deal, really. Unless of course, your wife is a neatnik, or your conscience bothers you.
Considering your strict upbringing it's interesting that you have been able to keep a casual attitude about such things.
Sometimes being too compulsive about things can really put a strain on life -- but then again, so can not having any clean socks to wear!
It must have been your strict upbringing that makes you feel this way.
That is odd -- there's nothing in your past or in your upbringing that would make you feel concerned about such things.
As you approach the hamper, the crowd begins to murmur in the background... there are two seconds left on the clock and the score is tied...
The shot is up... the buzzer sounds...
SCORE! THE GAME IS OVER! YOUR TEAM WINS! THE CROWD IS GOING WILD! YOU STUB YOUR TOE! It's back to the real world.
HE MISSES! YOUR TEAM LOSES THE PLAYOFFS! (I know, no fair, I didn't mention that it was the playoffs, but I didn't want to put too much pressure on you.) There's always tomorrow's game.
PASS? What do you mean, PASS?! You must be either very tired or have a very poor imagination. How do you ever expect to become a star?

You are so neat and wonderful. This will contribute to great success in life, but every once in awhile you have to let go, live a little. Wouldn't you just love to try to make a fifty-foot jump shot with those socks, right into the old
